DataElement.preferredName: Stage III Stage IV Relapsed Refractory Progressive Disease Mycosis Fungoides Sezary Syndrome Post One Systemic Treatment Regimen Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify a patient with Stage III or IV refractory, relapsed or progressive Sezary Syndrome or Mycosis Fungoides after one standard systemic therapy regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage III Stage IV Relapsed Refractory Progressive Disease Mycosis Fungoides Sezary Syndrome Post Greater Than or Equal To One Systemic Treatment Regimen
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites._Cancer that has spread to distant anatomic sites beyond its original site of growth._Not responding to treatment._Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity._A peripheral (mature) T-cell lymphoma presenting in the skin with patches/plaques. It is characterized by epidermal and dermal infiltration of small to medium-sized T-cells with cerebriform nuclei.  Patients with limited disease generally have an excellent prognosis.  In the more advanced stages, the prognosis is poor. (WHO, 2001)_Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways_Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body._The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Stage III Stage IV Refractory Progressive Disease Recurrent Disease Mycosis Fungoides
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.:Cancer that has spread to distant anatomic sites beyond its original site of growth.:Not responding to treatment.:Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.:The return of a disease after a period of remission.:A peripheral (mature) T-cell lymphoma presenting in the skin with patches/plaques. It is characterized by epidermal and dermal infiltration of small to medium-sized T-cells with cerebriform nuclei.  Patients with limited disease generally have an excellent prognosis.  In the more advanced stages, the prognosis is poor. (WHO, 2001)

Concepts.definition: Locally advanced cancer that has spread to nearby organs but not to distant anatomic sites.
Cancer that has spread to distant anatomic sites beyond its original site of growth.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

A peripheral (mature) T-cell lymphoma presenting in the skin with patches/plaques. It is characterized by epidermal and dermal infiltration of small to medium-sized T-cells with cerebriform nuclei.  Patients with limited disease generally have an excellent prognosis.  In the more advanced stages, the prognosis is poor. (WHO, 2001)

Property.preferredName: Post Greater Than or Equal To Integer::1 Systemic Therapy Treatment Regimen
Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1:Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patients must have Stage IIB-
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must have Stage IIB-IVB MF/SS, and have relapsed, are refractory, or progressed after at least one standard systemic therapy

DataElement.changeDescription: 5/28/15 released for use on CITN-10 Eligibility Checklist form. jc
